Package BackEnd

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • BackEnd.Main
  • public class Main
extends javafx.application.Application
    This is the main class in the application and holds the main logic that leads to what the user sees. It connects the back-end code to the JavaFX GUI and launches the application.
    Version:
    2.3
    Author:
    Ollie

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Main()
      The constructor initialises the state of the application and loads in the dictionary data from the Json files.

    • Method Detail

      • addToPracticeList

        public void addToPracticeList​(Word word)
        Add word to practice list
        Parameters:
        word - to be added

      • removeFromPracticeList

        public void removeFromPracticeList​(Word word)
        Remove word from practice list
        Parameters:
        word - to be removed

      • addWordBox

        public void addWordBox()
        Method for JavaFX code that creates a popup box to enter new word information. It is called by the 'Add Word' button in DictionaryDisplay. This method calls the addWord method to add information to the dictionary and practice list

      • addWord

        public void addWord​(Word word)
        Adds word to both the dictionary and the practice list if it is not already added.
        Parameters:
        word - gets added to both dictionary / practice list

      • setState

        public void setState​(int state)
        Set the state of the program (i.e. which screen the user is currently on).
        Parameters:
        state - becomes the new state of the program.

      • changeScene

        public void changeScene()
        Changes what is displayed on the screen according to what state the program is currently in. Keeps the default borders, but the centre pane is changed. This is called whenever the screen needs to be updated.

      • start

        public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        This starts up the main window at launch.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        stage - becomes the main window.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when error with the JavaFX.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        This main method is where the application is launched from.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments from command line
